text: The 1923 Argentine Primera División was the 32nd season of top-flight football in Argentina. The AFA season began on March 11 and ended on December?.Argentina 1923 by Osvaldo Gorgazzi at RSSSF.com Boca Juniors win its 3rd league title in the official AFA league while San Lorenzo achieved its first title ever at the top division winning the AAm championship. ==Final tables== ===Asociación Argentina de Football - Copa Campeonato=== As Boca Juniors and Huracán both finished with 51 points each, they had to play a best-of-three playoff to decide a champion. Palermo, which had been relegated from the Asociación Amateur, joined Asociación Argentina remaining at Primera División. Argentino de Quilmes returned to the top division after being relegated in 1918, while All Boys, Argentino de Banfield and Villa Urquiza made their debuts in Primera.Asociacion Argentina 1923 at Historia y Futbol ====Final playoffs==== \---- \---- With the third match drawn, the series was level at 1-1, meaning a fourth match - to be played to a finish - was required to determine the champion. {| style="width:100%" class="wikitable collapsible collapsed" |- !Team details |- | {| style="font-size: 90%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" |- !width=25| !!width=25| |- |GK || || Américo Tesoriere |- |DF || || Ludovico Bidoglio |- |DF || || Ramón Muttis |- |MF || || Angel Médici |- |MF || || Mario Busso |- |MF |||| Alfredo Elli |- |FW |||| Pedro Calomino |- |FW |||| Antonio Cerroti |- |FW |||| Alfredo Garassini |- |FW || || Carmelo Pozzo |- |FW || || Dante Pertini |- |} {| style="font-size: 90%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" align=center |- !width=25| !!width=25| |- |GK || || Vicente Marmo |- |DF || || Carlos Nóbile |- |DF || || Juan F. Pratto |- |MF || || Cayetano Federico |- |MF || || Ramón Vázquez |- |MF || || Juan B. Scursoni |- |FW || || Adán Loizo |- |FW || || Juan Rodríguez |- |FW || || Vicente Chiarante |- |FW || || Ángel Chiesa |- |FW || || Cesáreo Onzari |- |} |} ===Asociación Amateurs de Football=== Argentino del Sud (promoted last year) debuted in Primera División. ==References== Category:Argentine Primera División seasons Category:1923 in Argentine football Category:1923 in South American football
